results.title: New life - new ways
results.brief_description: Examines the potential loneliness and isolation faced by migrant women coming to live in urban Australia. Highlights the many inadequacies of Australian support systems to cope with the special problems of non-English speaking migrant women. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Any questions?
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the problems of generating group discussions. After completing a complicated explanation, a trainer asks questions of the group. In his despair at failing to elicit questions he jumps out the window.

results.title: World within worlds
results.brief_description: Through time-lapse, macro and microphotography the viewer sees examples of the natural processes which the human eye cannot perceive, such as the mysteries of cell division and the inexplicable auras revealed by Kirlian photography. From the series “NGS Educational films”.

results.title: Franklin River journey
results.creator_credit: Bob Connolly, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film depicts a three week journey down the Franklin River by botanist Antonius Moscal. Portrays his appreciation of the environment and the studies which he carries out. Suitable for Middle Secondary level. Narration by John Bluthal.

results.title: Gallipoli
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm, J McGrath, Frank Hunter, ABC and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: A recreation of the futile attempt to capture the straits of Bosphorous in 1915 in order to gain control of Constantinople. Shows the needles loss of life, caused by the poor command of Gallipoli, Cape Helles and Suvla Bay. Makes use of documentary footage. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: China mission
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, Lydia Semotuk, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A biography of Chester Ronning told through the use of mostly contemporary stills and some silent footage. Chester Ronning was born in Francheng, China, in 1894, the son of Norwegian missionaries. Until his death at the age of ninety, he was everything from a cowboy to an ambassador, a college president to a Peace River homesteader, a missionary to a member of the Alberta legislature. But Ronning, who died in December 1984, is best remebered in international circles for his long and close relationship with China. Throughout his many careers, including that of Canadian High Commissioner to India, ambassador to Norway, and head of an international mission in 1966 to end the war in Vietnam, Ronning’s lifelong ambition was to explain China to the western world. His story is a rare example of the meeting of east and west in a compassionate, remarkable man. Narrated by Cedric Smith. (Awards: San Antonio; San Francisco).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Radford, Lydia Semotuk, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: What is ecology? - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates basic terms in the science of ecology. Explores plant and animal relationships and their interdependence for survival through several major biomes. Addresses the constant danger of human activity to the ecological balance.
